bill_title: increase funding for education, to reduce state government reliance on lottery proceeds, and to revise the distribution of lottery proceeds.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to increase funding for education, to reduce state government reliance on lottery proceeds, and to revise the distribution of lottery proceeds. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 42-7A-63 be amended to read as follows: 42-7A-63. The commission shall maximize revenues to the state from video lottery. The state's percentage of net machine income shall be fifty percent. The state's percentage of net machine income shall be directly deposited to the property tax reduction fund and trust fund created by S.D. Const., Art XIII, § 20 , except for one-half of one percent of net machine income authorized for deposit into the video lottery operating fund. The effective date of this section is July 1, 1996. The revenue collected pursuant to this section shall be distributed in the following manner: (1) During fiscal year 2003, eighty-nine and one-half percent shall be deposited in the property tax reduction fund. During fiscal year 2004, seventy-nine and one-half percent shall be deposited in the property tax reduction fund. During fiscal year 2005, sixty-nine and one-half percent shall be deposited in the property tax reduction fund. During fiscal year 2006, fifty-nine and one-half percent shall be deposited in the property tax reduction fund. During fiscal year 2007, forty-nine and one-half percent shall be deposited in the property tax reduction fund. During fiscal year 2008, thirty- nine and one-half percent shall be deposited in the property tax reduction fund. During fiscal year 2009, twenty-nine and one-half percent shall be deposited in the property tax reduction fund. During fiscal year 2010, nineteen and one-half percent shall be deposited in the property tax reduction fund. During fiscal year 2011, nine and one- half percent shall be deposited in the property tax reduction fund. Beginning in fiscal year 2012 and each year thereafter no lottery proceeds shall be deposited in the property tax reduction fund; and (2) During fiscal year 2003, ten percent shall be deposited in the trust fund created by S.D. Const., Art XIII, § 20. During fiscal year 2004, twenty percent shall be deposited in the trust fund created by S.D. Const., Art XIII, § 20. During fiscal year 2003, ten percent shall be deposited in the trust fund created by S.D. Const., Art XIII, § 20. During fiscal year 2005, thirty percent shall be deposited in the trust fund created by S.D. Const., Art XIII, § 20. During fiscal year 2006, forty percent shall be deposited in the trust fund created by S.D. Const., Art XIII, § 20. During fiscal year 2007, fifty percent shall be deposited in the trust fund created by S.D. Const., Art XIII, § 20. During fiscal year 2008, sixty percent shall be deposited in the trust fund created by S.D. Const., Art XIII, § 20. During fiscal year 2009, seventy percent shall be deposited in the trust fund created by S.D. Const., Art XIII, § 20. During fiscal year 2010, eighty percent shall be deposited in the trust fund created by S.D. Const., Art XIII, § 20. During fiscal year 2011, ninety percent shall be deposited in the trust fund created by S.D. Const., Art XIII, § 20. Beginning in fiscal year 2012, and each year thereafter, ninety-nine and one half percent shall be deposited in the trust fund created by S.D. Const., Art XIII, § 20.
